question: Why Shark Likes Shake The Fishing Boat, Because It Wants To Tickle?

knowledge: Elephant Uses Its Trunk As A Walking Stick To Find Its Way Around。

question: Does The Bee More Like To Sting Who Wears Colorful Cloth With Perfume?

question: Does Play The Piano To The Cow Could Make It Produce More Milk?
knowledge: The Cow Has The Complete Hearing Nerve System, Music Could Make It Produce More Milk.

question: Mud Eel Only Born Girl, Not Boy. Does It True?

question: “Be a winged bird in heaven, a twig on earth.”Does This Bird Is Mandarin Duck？

question: Does Monkey'S Butt Turn Red Because It'S In Heat？

question: When A Woodpecker Cuts Through A Tree Trunk To Find A Worm Deep Inside, Does It Pick It Up With A Mouth？
knowledge: It Sticks Worm Out By Tongue。

question: Is It Because Monkeys Have Good Digestion That  Eat So Fast？
knowledge: Monkeys Have A Pouch On Each Side Of Their Mouth Called A Cheek Pouch, It Used To Store Food. Monkeys Like Store The Robbed Food In, Then Chew It Slowly. That'S Why They Look Eat Fast.

question: “A flying moth darts into the fire .”Dose It Died By Fire Burns？
knowledge: Flying Moth Fly In The Evening, They Distinguish Direction Depend On Moonlight. They Will Mistake Fire For The Moon. They Need To Keep A Fixed Angle With The Light, So They Will Fly Around The Fire Until Die. They Are Tired To Death

question: Do Animals Play With Each Other To Kill Time？
knowledge: They Play For Exercise. Like The Chasing Dog, Besides Exercise, It Will Strengthen Muscle. Rush Increases The Durability And Heart Function, It Is Helpful To Survive.

question: Is It True That Rabbits Have Diarrhea When They Drink Water？
knowledge: They Eat Grass. There Is Enough Water In It. So They Will Diarrhea When Drink Water.

question: Do Fat Cats And Dogs Have Fat On Their Bellies？
knowledge: Fat Cats Have Beer Bellies Just Like Humans, And Fat Dogs Have A Fairly Uniform Circle Around Their Bodies.

question: Why Alpacas Spit On Each Other When They Fail To Woo A Mate？
knowledge: Alpacas Is Gentle. But Once They Have Been Attacked Or Failed On Courtship, They Will Spit. You Will Never Forget That Smell.

question: Do Alpacas Like To Go To The Bathroom Together？
knowledge: Alpacas Are Very Afraid Of Loneliness. If You Feed Singly, It Will Be Lonely To Die. So They Like To Get Together To Do Anything.

question: Squirrels Can Dry Mushrooms And Eat Them？
knowledge: Their Foods Are Usually Nuts And Berries. For American Red Squirrels, Their Food Is The Wild Mushroom. They Will Hang Mushrooms On Trees To Dry Them And Take Them Home For The Winter.

question: Do The Eyes Of Reindeer Will Change Color？
knowledge: In The Summer Of The North Pole, Their Eyes Are Golden. Once The Dark Of Winter Coming, The Eyes Will Change To Blue. Scientists Analyzed That Is The Different Sunlight Conditions In Summer And Winter Causes The Changes Of The Light Membrane Structure

question: Are Seahorses The World'S Most Transsexual Animals？
knowledge: Seahorses Can'T Transfer Gender. But There Is An Animal Called A Clownfish, Males Can Become Females And Females Cannot Become Males. Each Clownfish Population Has A Dominant Female And Several Adult Males. If The Dominant Female Dies, One Of The Adult Males Will Undergo Hormonal Changes And Become The New Female In The Population

question: Does Mosquito All Can Suck Blood？
knowledge: Not All Mosquitoes Feed On Blood, Only Females Feed After Mating. It'S For Reproduction.Male Mosquitoes Only Suck Grass Juice, Nectar To Live, So Do Not Suck Blood

question: Is It True That Cats Go Blind From Eating Dog Food？
knowledge: Since There Is No Taurine Necessary For Cats In Dog Food, Cats Cannot Synthesize Taurine Themselves And Can Only Obtain It Through Food. Long-Term Lack Of Taurine In Cats Will Lead To Blindness And Heart Failure, So Cats Should Not Buy The Wrong Food！

question: Flies Like To Vomit When They Eat？
knowledge: The Fly Is Accustomed To Eat, Spit, Pull, Because It Will Also Eat Into Their Adverse Bacteria, Eating While Vomiting Is Conducive To The Rapid Expulsion Of Bacteria

question: After Tigers Shaving, There Is Still A Tiger Pattern On The Skin. Is That True?？
knowledge: Tigers Still Have Stripes Under Their Fur, And Each Tiger Has A Different Stripe, Just Like A Human Fingerprint.

question: There Is A Kind Of Animal Poop, Which Is Square Like Chocolate？
knowledge: Koalas Are Animals With A Four-Ridged Gut. The Less Water There Is During The Dewatering Process, The More Angular The Poop Is. For Koalas, The Square Poop Is Used Primarily To Mark Territory. The Square Poop Doesn'T Roll Easily, So It Won'T Roll Away Even If Placed On Top Of Bare Rock.

question: Is It True That Crocodiles Don'T Have Tongues？
knowledge: Crocodiles Actually Have Tongues, But They Are Too Degenerate And Inflexible To Stick Them Out.

question: Do Flies Taste Sweet？
knowledge: Flies Generally Taste Sweet, And Pregnant Flies Must Be Sweet Because You Eat 80% Of The Eggs, Eggs Are Very Sweet. But The Fly Itself Carries A Lot Of Germs, Think Of The Places It Frequents, It Has More Germs Than Nutrients, You'D Better Not Try It!

question: Is It True That Ants Never Sleep？
knowledge: Sleep, As An Advanced Nervous System Function, Does Not Exist In The Lower Animals, But They Need To Take Frequent Breaks For Several Minutes, Just Like Human Naps. Because They Take Many Naps, They Also Need To Rest For 2-3 Hours Over The Course Of A Day.

question: If You Are Bitten By A Mosquito, Draw A Circle On The Bag With A Ballpoint Pen To Reduce The Swelling And Itch？
knowledge: Ballpoint Pen Contains Alkaline Substance, The Itching Caused By Mosquito Bite Is Mainly Formic Acid; It Neutralizes The Acid, So It Doesn'T Itch; It'S The Same Thing With Soap, And Soap Works Even Better.

question: The Sex Of A Baby Turtle Is Not Innate But Is Determined By Temperature？
knowledge: Tortoise hatchings are controlled by temperature. When the outside temperature is low, the hatchlings are male. When the outside temperature is high, the hatchlings are female, and the birth of boys and girls is determined by nature.

question: Do Pigs Have High IQs Among Animals？
knowledge: Pigs Belong To Higher Intelligence Quotient In The Animal, And The Pig'S Sense Of Smell Is Very Sensitive, Many Countries Customs Airport Have Used Pigs To Search For Drugs And Contraband, Please Call Them Anti-Drug Pigs.

question: Elephants Drink With Their Trunks And Never Choke？
knowledge: Behind The Elephant'S Nose Above A Piece Of Cartilage, Like An Elephant Drinking Water With Its Nose Valve, The Cartilage Will Automatically Close, The Mouth Trachea Blocked, Water Will Directly Through The Nose And Down Into The Esophagus, And Not Into The Trachea When Elephants To Spit Out The Water, Cartilage And Automatically Open, Keep Elephants Breathe Smoothly.

question: Is Giant Salamander The Fish？
knowledge: The Giant Salamander, The World'S Largest And Most Valuable Living Amphibian, Is Not A Fish But Gets Its Name Because Its Cry Resembles A Baby'S Cry.

question: Are Snakes Related To Lizards？
knowledge: Snakes Are Closely Related To Lizards. They Are Closely Related. Snakes Are Descended From Ancient Lizards.

question: Is The Zebra'S Beautiful Pattern For Survival？

question: Elephants Can'T Jump Or Run？
knowledge: They Can'T Even Lie Down, And They Never Run, For All Four Legs Never Get Off The Ground At The Same Time. Even When The Elephant Is Moving The Fastest, It Can Only Be Said That It Is Walking Fast.

question: Does A Dog Wagging Its Tail To The Left Mean It Is Sad？
knowledge: when a dog is in a positive mood or curious about things, its tail waggles to the right. when dogs experience negative emotions or even fear, their tails swing to the left, a sign that is the result of a division of labor between their left and right brains.

question: Hippo Sweat Is A Natural Sunscreen？
knowledge: Hippo sweat glands secrete a substance called hippo sweat acid, which can absorb 200-600nm wavelength of light, including ultraviolet wavelengths, therefore, this substance has the effect of sun protection not only that, it also has the effect of inhibition of bacteria this substance is red, so it is the real blood sweat BMW！

question: Squirrels Recognize Each Other By Kissing Their Mouths？
knowledge: Unlike humans, squirrels don't seem to have a facial recognition system. When they meet, they kiss to confirm each other's identity, and the chances of success are high! But wouldn't it be embarrassing to admit that you were wrong after kissing？

question: Is Octopus Blood Blue？
knowledge: A Lot Of Vertebrate Blood Is Red Because Our Blood Has A Protein Called Hemoglobin, And Because Octopus Blood Doesn'T Have Any Hemoglobin, It'S Also De-Oxygenated, And The Oxygen Is Transported By Another (Less Efficient) Protein, Called Hemoglobin, Which Makes The Octopus Blood Blue.

question: Do Rabbits Like To Eat Their Own Poop？
knowledge: Because Rabbit Poop At Night Is Rich In B-Vitamin Protein And Plant Fiber And Only When Rabbits Are Sick Do They Stop Eating Their Poop.

question: Do Crocodiles Like To Eat Stones As Well As Meat？
knowledge: Crocodiles Eat Rocks To Aid Digestion And To Adjust Their Buoyancy.

question: Do Males Peck Females To Woo Them？
knowledge: Male Penguins Are Masters At Dating. In The Early Stages Of A Relationship, Male Penguins Send Their Females Smooth Pebbles As Tokens Of Affection. If The Females Agree To A Relationship, They Carry The Stones Home.

question: Do Snails Have The Most Teeth In The World？
knowledge: The Average Snail Has A Mouth About The Size Of A Pin, But It Has More Than 26,000 Teeth. All The Teeth Of A Snail Are On The Tongue, So You Can Hardly See Them, But They Are Very Sharp. Although Snails Have Many Teeth, They Are Not Used For Chewing.

question: Why Pufferfish Is Extremely Poisonous But Can'T Poison Itself？
knowledge: Puffer Fish May Also Be Poisoned By Tetrodotoxin. However, Puffer Fish Is Highly Resistant To Toxin, Which Is 1000 Times As Much As The General Fish. Puffer Fish Will Secrete Toxin When They Are Frightened, And Sometimes They Will Poison Themselves If They Secrete Too Much.

question: Do Penguins Like To Sleep On Their Stomachs？
knowledge: Most Penguins Sleep Standing Up. They Usually Sleep With Their Bills Buried Under Their Wings.

question: When Pigs Are Excited, They Look Up At The Sky？
knowledge: Because Of The Degeneration Of Cervical Vertebrae, The Pig Can'T Lift Its Head Above 20. This Is Caused By The Physiological Structure, So It Can'T Look Up To The Sky For The Whole Life.

question: Why Horse Always Sleeps Standing Up？
knowledge: Horse Doesn'T Have To Sleep At Night, Much Less Through The Night. If No One Disturbs Him, He Can Sleep Anytime, Anywhere, Standing Or Lying Down.

question: Is Polar Bear'S Skin  Black？
knowledge: The Fur Of A Polar Bear Appears White, But The Skin Is Black. If You Look At Its Nose, PAWS, Lips, And Hairless Areas Around Its Eyes, You Can See The Black Skin.

question: Do Cats Like To Eat Sweet Things As Much As Humans Do？
knowledge: Cats' Tongues Can Taste Sweet And Sour, Bitter And Spicy, But Have A Weak Sensitivity To Sweetness. Cats Actually Prefer Salty Things.

question: Lizards Need Calcium Just Like Humans, But Lizards Get It By Eating Their Own Tails？
knowledge: The Lizard'S Long Tail Is A Means Of Saving Itself In An Emergency, A Storehouse Of Nutrients, And Is Rich In Calcium, So The Lizard Eats Its Own Tail To Get Calcium.

question: A Turtle Can Breathe Not Only Through Its Mouth But Also Through Its Tail？
knowledge: Turtles Can Breathe Through Their Mouths And They Can Also Breathe Through Their Tails. In Winter, Tortoises Use Their Tails To Breathe Because It Saves Energy.

question: Does Fish Have A Memory Of Only Seven Seconds？
knowledge: Fish Memories Can Last For A Month Or More, And The Idea That Fish Memories Last Only Seven Seconds Is Just An Article, Not At All Credible.

question: Can Elephants  Communicate With Their Friends Ten Kilometers Away By Trampling The Ground？
knowledge: The Elephant Is So Heavy That When It Tramps On The Ground, It Sends Out Seismic Waves. As The Waves Travel From The Ground, They Pass Through Its Forefeet And Then Walk Up To Its Ear Bones, So That It Can Hear The Messages From Its Friends. The Seismic Waves Can Travel As Far As 20 Kilometers.

question: Owls Have Short Legs And Claws Below Their Bodies？
knowledge: In Fact, The Owl'S Legs And The Body Is Almost Long, But Feathers And Wings Are Blocked, Usually Can Not See The Owl'S Long Legs.

question: Big Sea Turtle Is The Longest-Lived Animal Known？
knowledge: The Oldest Known Animal Was An Arctic Quahog Clam, Which Was 507 Years Old But Died When Scientists Pulled It Out Of The Water.

question: Crayfish Eat Their Own Shells For Calcium？
knowledge: One Species, The Austa European Crayfish, Which Looks Similar To Our Crayfish, Eats Its Exoskeleton After Molting In Order To Restore Its Calcium Balance.

question: The Baby Elephant Holds Its Nose In Its Mouth To Show That It Is Hungry？
knowledge: Baby Elephants Hold Their Noses In Their Mouths To Feel Safe, Just As Human Babies Do When They Suck Their Thumbs

question: Blue Whales Don'T Fart In The Water？
knowledge: Not Only Does A Blue Whale Fart In The Water, But Its Fart Bubbles Are Large Enough To Wrap Around An Entire Horse！

question: Crows Have Better Memories Than Humans？
knowledge: Crows Have Terrible Memories And Can Recognize All The Human Faces They'Ve Seen In Their Lifetime, So The Question Is, Can You Recognize The Faces Of The People You'Ve Seen？

question: Squirrels Are Good Gardeners For Planting Trees？
knowledge: Although Squirrels Love Nuts, They Accidentally Plant Hundreds Of Trees Every Year Because They Bury Nuts In The Ground And Forget Where To Put Them.

question: Bats Are The Only Mammals That Can Really Fly？
knowledge: The Bat Is The Only Mammal That Can Fly Autonomously With The Vibration Of Its Wings. However, There Is A Type Of Rodent Called Flying Squirrel, With Soft Fur Folds Between Its Front And Hind Legs, Called The Skin Wing. With The Spread Of The Skin Wing, It Can Glide From Top To Bottom In The Air, Thus It Is Commonly Known As Flying Mouse.

question: An Ostrich'S Eye Is Bigger Than Its Brain？
knowledge: According To Biologists, The Brain Weight Of The Ostrich Is Only 26 Grams, Accounting For Only 0.015% Of Its Body Weight, Which Is More Than 17 Times The Difference With Poultry. This Proportion May Be The Smallest Among All Land Animal.

question: The Most Dangerous Animal In The World Is The Mosquito？
knowledge: The Most Dangerous Animals In The World Are The Mosquitoes That Effortlessly Claim The Title Because They Can Transmit Countless Diseases And Kill More Animals, Including Humans, Than Any Other Animal Or Plant On Earth.

question: Can Fleas Bounce Faster Than A Rocket Can Take Off？
knowledge: The Flea Jumps Off A Dog With 20 Times The Acceleration Of A Space Shuttle Launch! Engineers At NASA'S Jet Propulsion Laboratory Should Take A Good Look At Fleas.

question: Do Camels Have Three Eyelids？
knowledge: Survival Of The Fittest, The Environment In The Desert Is Very Harsh, There Is No Water In It, And It Is Extremely Dry. Once The Wind Blows, The Sand Will Fly Everywhere. In Order To Prevent The Sand From Blowing Into The Eyes, In The Long Process, The Camel Developed A Three-Layer Eyelid.

question: Do Mosquitoes Prefer To Stare At Type O Humans？
knowledge: When Mosquitoes Attack, They Prefer People With Higher Smell And Temperature, Such As Those Who Enjoy Sports And Sweat, Have High Lung Capacity And Heavy Breathing, As Well As Pregnant Women And Some Women During Their Menstrual Period. There Is No Direct Correlation Between Blood Type And Gender.

question: Can'T Zebras Sleep When They Have No Companions？
knowledge: Zebra Is A Social Animal, And Very Insecure, Only Their Own Words Will Not Sleep, Lonely When You Will Think Of Who, Do You Want To Find Another Zebra To Accompany？

question: Can Dogs Understand What'S On TV？
knowledge: Dogs Can'T See What'S Going On On The TV Screen, But They Pretend To Watch It Because It Brings Them Closer To Humans.

question: Do Ostriches  Walk Backwards Like Humans？
knowledge: Not Only Does An Ostrich Walk Backwards, But Its Body Can Also See Its Way Behind It, Because Its Eyes Are Very Large And Have A Wide View.

question: A Giraffe Can Pick Out Its Ears With Its Tongue？
knowledge: A Giraffe'S Tongue Is So Long That It Can Reach Into Its Ear With Ease, Reaching A Maximum Length Of 60 Cm In Adult Life.

question: Is Panda A Homeless Animal？
knowledge: Pandas Have No Fixed Residence Throughout Their Lives. They Like To Eat All The Way, And When They Are Full, They Will Find A Place To Sleep When They Feel Tired!

question: Will Ants Die When They Fall From A Height Of Ten Thousand Meters？
knowledge: For Ants, The Air Holds Them Back A Lot, And They'Re Light, So There'S No Danger Of Them Falling From High In The Air, But Ants Are Light, And The Wind Is Strong, So They Might Not Fall At All, Or They Might Take A Long Time To Fall To The Ground, And Then They'Ll Starve To Death.

question: Do Dogs Bark All The Time？
knowledge: There Really Is A Dog In The World That Doesn'T Bark Like Other Dogs, And Its Bark Is More Like Singing With A Fake Voice, This Dog Is Bashenj.

question: Are Dalmatian Dogs Born Without Spots？
knowledge: The Melanocytes In The Skin Of A Newborn Dalmatian Dog Have Not Yet Divided And Matured, So They Are Not Yet Capable Of Secreting Melanin, So Hair Is White Hair Without Melanin; But Over Time, As The Melanocytes Develop And Mature, The Dark Patches Appear.

question: Is A Butterfly'S Nose On Its Feet？
knowledge: Butterflies Have Olfactory Organs On Their Feet, So They Can Smell And Taste Flowers With Their Feet.

question: Can A Lioness Be A Lion King？
knowledge: The Female Lion Lives With Her Sister For The Rest Of Her Life, And Only The Male, As An Adult, Has To Hunt For Prey, Take Over Territory And Become A Dominant Force.

question: Among Mammals, Humans Have The Longest Hair？
knowledge: The Longest Hair In Humans Is Hair, Which Is Also The Longest Hair That Mammals Can Grow, Followed By Musk Ox Hair, Which Can Be Up To 60 Centimeters Long.

question: The Wolf Bites His Comrade In The Mouth Is Demonstration？
knowledge: A Wolf Shows Love By Gently Biting The Other'S Mouth, It Is Not Demonstration！

question: Is The Gas Mask  Based On The Face Of A Horse？
knowledge: When The Boar Smell Poisonous Gas, Instinct With Mouth Arch Ground, Let Their Mouth Buried Under The Earth.When The Poison Gas Is Filtered Through The Soil, It Can'T Hurt The Wild Boar.Later, Some People, Imitating The Face Of Wild Boar, Made The Simplest Gas Mask At That Time, Using Some Clay And Some Porous Material. This Gas Mask Had A Certain Filtering Effect On The Poisonous Gas.

question: Humans Lie, Is Some Animals Same？
knowledge: Some animals in nature often lie to profit from it. For example, a chimpanzee may tell another chimpanzee that there is a banana nearby, but it does not move. But when another chimpanzee gropes for the banana, the chimpanzee stands up, gropes for the real banana alone, and makes a hearty meal.Such a diversion speaks for its cunning

question: Do Rabbits Have Red Eyes？
knowledge: Generally Speaking, The Color Of A Rabbit'S Eyes Is Related To The Color Of Its Fur. The Eye Color Is The Same As The Color Of Its Fur, While The White Rabbit'S Eyes Are Transparent And Red Inside.

question: Will A Flea Cannot Get Tired If It Jumps All The Time？
knowledge: Fleas' Muscles Do Not Produce Lactic Acid, So Fleas Are Not Fatigued.

question: Does The Giant Panda'S Fresh Poop Stinks？
knowledge: Because Their Intestines Are Too Short, Giant Pandas Can Eat And Pull While Eating. Moreover, Giant Pandas Have Weak Digestion Ability, And Bamboo Digestion Is Not Complete. Panda Poo Just Pulled Out Has No Odor, But A Fresh Smell Of Bamboo.

question: Does The Sperm Whale Have Only One Nostril？
knowledge: Sperm Whales Have Two Nostrils, But Only The Left Nostril Is Open For Breathing.The Right Nostril Is Naturally Obstructed, Which Causes The Sperm Whale To Always Lean To The Right When It Comes To The Surface To Breathe, With A Column Of Spray Coming Out About 45 Angles To The Left And In Front

question: Polar Bears Are Not Afraid Of The Cold Because They Have Thick Hair？
knowledge: Polar Bears Have A Lot Of Fat, This Is The Nutrient With The Highest Calorific Value.Polar Bears Rely On The Metabolism Of Fat To Produce Enough Heat To Keep Out The Cold.In Addition, Their Fur Is Very Special. It Is A Small Hollow Tube That Reflects Sunlight Onto The Dark Skin Under The Hair, Which Helps Absorb More Heat And Protect Polar Bears From The Arctic Cold

question: Could Raising Pigs Protects Against Snakes？
knowledge: Because The Pig Is Protected By Thick Fat, It Can Neutralize The Venom And Prevent It From Getting Into The Blood Vessels. It Can Not Only Stomp The Snake To Death, But Also Eat It.

question: The Duckling Does Not Know Its Mother After It Is Born？
knowledge: A Duckling Identifies Anything He Sees Within 10 Minutes Of Being Born As His Mother, So His Mother Can Be Anything.

question: Chickens Are Very Timid And Are Easily Frightened To Death？
knowledge: Chickens Are Famous For Their Fear Of Scaring Animals, And Are Often Frightened To Death On The Spot By Loud Noises！

question: Humans Stop Growing As Adults, But Dinosaurs Grow All Their Lives？
knowledge: Studies Suggest That Reptiles, Such As Crocodiles And Lizards, Have Few Blood Vessels, A Single Shape, And Form A Growth Line Similar To Tree Rings Every Year.
